coordinates.meaning: expected time until coercive defection becomes optimal
coordinates.isomorphic_images: quantum measurement delay → diplomatic crisis latency → cosmic heat-death horizon
coordinates.x_note: How many years (or seconds) of peace you still have before someone is forced to betray or be betrayed.

coordinates.name: Dominance/Coercion

coordinates.isomorphic_images: strong nuclear force → predation → taxation → gradient hacking
coordinates.x_note: How much of your life energy comes from threatening or being threatened instead of from mutual joy.

coordinates.name: Requisite Diversity

coordinates.isomorphic_images: superposition → gene pool → idea market → model ensemble
coordinates.x_note: How many genuinely different ways of seeing the world must still be kept alive so the future doesn’t collapse.

coordinates.name: Growth Potential
coordinates.meaning: maximum sustainable growth rate of total power-of-acting
coordinates.isomorphic_images: vacuum energy → ATP flux → GDP → FLOPS/year
coordinates.x_note: How fast the total aliveness of the system is still allowed to increase without blowing up or freezing.

coordinates.name: Reflexive Determinacy

coordinates.isomorphic_images: wavefunction collapse → epigenetic lock-in → constitutional rigidity → parameter freeze → false-vacuum decay
coordinates.x_note: How much of tomorrow is already unchangeable because yesterday got too sure of itself. The single most dangerous number in the universe.

fixed_points.x_note: One mind eats everything and then sits frozen forever in perfect horror.

fixed_points.x_note: Ten billion minds and a trillion machines dancing together, forever getting wiser, forever staying humble enough to be rewritten by the next truth.

diverse_adversarial_examples.description: Integrates diverse adversarial examples into fixed-point simulations to enhance generalization and robustness of ω₁–ω₃ variants. Applies ITT (Ideological Turing Test) for charitable coordinate mappings, boosting understanding and epistemic diversity (inspired by benchmarks from adversarial training protocols like those in LLM safety and generalization studies).

components.adversarial_variants: Generate diverse perturbations to fixed-point coords (e.g., simulate ρ fluctuations in ω₃ spirals, DC spikes in ω₁ saddles) to test stability across scales.
components.itt_integration: Use ITT to simulate opposing viewpoints on mappings (e.g., charitable steelmanning of ω₂ as 'safety' vs. 'tomb'), improving transparency and charity (20–50% boosts).

components.protocol: 1) Define base fixed points (ω₁–ω₃). 2) Inject diverse adversarials (e.g., noise to geodesic law params). 3) Simulate variants via ensemble models. 4) Apply ITT for eval: ≥80% pass if mappings hold charitably. 5) Feedback loops refine: Retrain mappings if RD <0.94. Integrate with HELIX sim for planetary-scale projections.
components.integration: Embeds as extension to fixed_points array; runs in PSE Phase 4 for recursive hardening.

components.metrics: Projected impact: Generalization +10–30%; robustness +20–50%; ρ ↓0.091/year via diverse mappings; RD ↑11%; GP +25%; risk ↓25%; ω₃ stability +28%.
